channel.title: Compiling issues
channel.description:
I need the compiler code for Windows 7 64 Bit! I HAVE TRIED EVERYTHING :(
Using battlescape source I read the other post that was solved today with this same issue, but it did not help me.
I get this error when trying to compile my client
[code]javac: file not found: *.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
I have all my variables set, and in the compiler.bat here is what I have [code]@echo off title BattleScape Compiler "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause[/code]

item.title: Compiling issues
item.dc:creator: @Icey69 Icey69
item.description:
@Icey69 wrote:

They are all located in that folder, it worked on my other computer just not on this one

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling issues
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

Put all your .java files where your .class files are because your compiler is grabbing the .java files from the mail folder and compiles them into raw data in the main folder aswell.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling issues
item.dc:creator: @Icey69 Icey69
item.description:
@Icey69 wrote:

So how do I do that? the java files are in the same folder as the compiler. which is D:\*******\Desktop\Server things\Client

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling issues
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

You have your compiler set to compile the java files in a folder, and the folder dosen’t have anything to grab.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling issues
item.dc:creator: @Mattiaspope Mattiaspope
item.description:
@Mattiaspope wrote:

Try this.

@echo off
title BattleScape Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause

Read full topic
